ComplexType.name: ACLineSegment
ComplexType.Comment: A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.

For symmetrical, transposed 3ph lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment. Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.

Domain.name: b0ch
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Domain.name: bch
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section. This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line.

Domain.name: g0ch
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Domain.name: gch
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Domain.name: r
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

Domain.name: r0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

Domain.name: x
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

Domain.name: x0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

Reference.name: PerLengthImpedance
Reference.Comment: Per-length impedance of this line segment.

ComplexType.name: ConductingEquipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of the power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

ComplexType.name: Conductor
ComplexType.Comment: Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

Domain.name: length
Domain.Comment: Segment length for calculating line section capabilities

ComplexType.name: ConnectivityNodeContainer
ComplexType.Comment: A base class for all objects that may contain connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

ComplexType.name: DCLineSegment
ComplexType.Comment: A wire or combination of wires not insulated from one another, with consistent electrical characteristics, used to carry direct current between points in the DC region of the power system.

Domain.name: dcSegmentInductance
Domain.Comment: Inductance of the DC line segment.

Domain.name: dcSegmentResistance
Domain.Comment: Resistance of the DC line segment.

ComplexType.name: Equipment
ComplexType.Comment: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

Simple.name: aggregate
Simple.Comment: The single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modeled together as an aggregate. Examples would be power transformers or sychronous machines operating in parallel modeled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. This is not to be used to indicate equipment that is part of a group of interdependent equipment produced by a network production program.

Simple.name: normallyInService
Simple.Comment: If true, the equipment is normally in service.

ComplexType.name: EquipmentContainer
ComplexType.Comment: A modeling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

ComplexType.name: IdentifiedObject
ComplexType.Comment: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

Simple.name: mRID
Simple.Comment: Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqeness is easily achived by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Simple.name: aliasName
Simple.Comment: The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

Simple.name: name
Simple.Comment: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

ComplexType.name: Line
ComplexType.Comment: Contains equipment beyond a substation belonging to a power transmission line.

Reference.name: Region
Reference.Comment: The sub-geographical region of the line.

ComplexType.name: PerLengthImpedance
ComplexType.Comment: Common type for per-length impedance electrical catalogues.

Reference.name: ACLineSegments
Reference.Comment: All line segments described by this per-length impedance.

ComplexType.name: PerLengthSequenceImpedance
ComplexType.Comment: Sequence impedance and admittance parameters per unit length, for transposed lines of 1, 2, or 3 phases. For 1-phase lines, define x=x0=xself. For 2-phase lines, define x=xs-xm and x0=xs+xm.

Domain.name: b0ch
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: bch
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: g0ch
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: gch
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: r
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence series resistance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: r0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence series resistance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: x
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence series reactance, per unit of length.

Domain.name: x0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence series reactance, per unit of length.

ComplexType.name: PowerSystemResource
ComplexType.Comment: A power system resource can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated.

ComplexType.name: SeriesCompensator
ComplexType.Comment: A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance. It is a two terminal device.

Domain.name: r
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence resistance.

Domain.name: r0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence resistance.

Domain.name: x
Domain.Comment: Positive sequence reactance.

Domain.name: x0
Domain.Comment: Zero sequence reactance.

ComplexType.name: SubGeographicalRegion
ComplexType.Comment: A subset of a geographical region of a power system network model.

Reference.name: Lines
Reference.Comment: The lines within the sub-geographical region.

SimpleType.name: Inductance
SimpleType.Comment: Inductive part of reactance (imaginary part of impedance), at rated frequency.

SimpleType.name: ResistancePerLength
SimpleType.Comment: Resistance (real part of impedance) per unit of length.

SimpleType.name: ConductancePerLength
SimpleType.Comment: Real part of admittance per unit of length.

SimpleType.name: ReactancePerLength
SimpleType.Comment: Reactance (imaginary part of impedance) per unit of length, at rated frequency.

SimpleType.name: Reactance
SimpleType.Comment: Reactance (imaginary part of impedance), at rated frequency.

SimpleType.name: SusceptancePerLength
SimpleType.Comment: Imaginary part of admittance per unit of length.

SimpleType.name: Conductance
SimpleType.Comment: Factor by which voltage must be multiplied to give corresponding power lost from a circuit. Real part of admittance.
